data.title: [TRACKER] GridMap related issues
data.body:
### Gridmap:
- [x] Cannot create a MeshLibrary for GridMap, either using ArrayMesh or procedural meshes #10118 (bug)
- [x] GridMap does not work #9111 (bug)

- [x] Cannot edit grids in the 3D viewport #10395 (bug)
- [ ] Gridmap editor doesn't respects cell scale #10128 (bug) 
- [ ] Duplication of tiles is broken in Gridmap #8812 (bug)
- [ ] Crash when Octant size is set to 0 #6515 (bug)
- [ ] GridMap always visible even when set not visible #907 (bug)
- [ ] Include transforms of tile object's children when generating .meshlib file #11722 (bug)
- [ ] Freelook mode does not play well with Gridmap editor #10697 (bug/enhancement)
- [ ] Wrong UV mapping when atlasing enabled for 3D objects #6207  (enhancement)
- [ ] Pick up tile from map #3829 (enhancement)
- [ ] Collision section of GridMap is outdated when compared to TileMap, (No collision Layers) #3284 (enhancement)
- [ ] Add a get_used_cells() method like in TileMap #11857 (enhancement)
- [ ] Convert an arbitrary point in world space, to GridMap cell coordinates #11856 (enhancement)
- [ ] A signal or callback for on_cell_changed() #11855 (enhancement)

### More wide ones:
- [ ] Node Concepts for Module: Grid2D, Grid3D, HexGrid2D, HexGrid3D #10005 (discussion, feature request)


### Postponed to 3.1:
- [ ] More obvious way to rotate GridMap tiles #6639 (enhancement)
- [ ]  Hide tiles when mouse hovering over them (to give ability to see how gridmap will look like after placing new tile) #5526 (enhancement)

_(fell free to propose related issues, but note that I will moderate this thread in case of off-topics)_

data.title: line edit and other edit nodes- please add ability to limit what characters can be entered via a regex string
data.body:
Please add ability to limit what characters can be entered via a regex string in the line edit and other edit nodes.
It would be a nice addition to the edit box class in general.
This is a very basic and commonly used requirement to building interfaces, as more often than not some inputs should allow only numeric input without spaces or only text

Bellow is an example code that adds it via gdscript.
```
extends LineEdit

export var regexLimitString = '[0-9]'
func _on_LineEdit_text_changed( text ):
        if regexLimitString.length() != 0:
	         var cursorPos = get_cursor_pos()
	         set_text(returnSpecificSymbolsOnly(text,regexLimitString))
	         set_cursor_pos(cursorPos)

func returnSpecificSymbolsOnly(enteredText,regex):
	var word = ''
	for letter in enteredText:
		var resultingText = RegEx.new()
		resultingText.compile(regex,9) #search pattern
		if resultingText.find(letter,0,-1) != -1 : word = word+letter
	return word
```

I also wrote a plugin that does it and will upload it soon

However it would be nicer to have it built into godot!

data.title: Script editor font size zoom gets stuck at maximum
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** MacOS 10.12.6 - Godot 3.0a1


**Issue description:**
When using zoom keys (Meta+Equal, Meta+Minus) in the Script Editor, font size zooms once and then jumps bigger on its own. After 2 or 3 zooms (in either direction) font becomes very large and will no longer change. 




**Steps to reproduce:**
See attached gif:

1. open script
1. press Command+Equal , font zooms in once, then jumps bigger on its own
1. press Command+Minus, font zooms out once, then jumps to a huge value 
1. after this, no further zoom commands work and setting persists after restart

![screen grab](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3812514/29441298-26f2ef9c-837f-11e7-904c-760b83f6dacd.gif)

Only way I found to fix is to edit the `editor_settings-3.tres` and change  `interface/source_font_size` to a reasonable value.

data.title: Using `--gdnative-generate-json-api` flag causes errors
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
4.10.0-30-generic x86_64 GNU/Linux
godot: 3a4ff34 

**Issue description:**
Launching godot with the `--gdnative-generate-json-api` flag still launches the editor. If you provide an output file name to the flag, godot returns an error in loading the scene. 

I would expect the editor to not be launched if using this flag or at the very least not use the same arg to look for a scene.

```shell
$ ./godot.x11.tools.64 --gdnative-generate-json-api foobaby.json
OpenGL ES 3.0 Renderer: GeForce GTX 780/PCIe/SSE2
GLES3: max ubo light: 409
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 455, ubo size: 144
ERROR: load: No loader found for resource: res://foobaby.json
   At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:223.
ERROR: start: Failed loading scene: res://foobaby.json
   At: main/main.cpp:1462.
WARNING: cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
```

data.title: Error importing large textures with .tex extension target
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: 2.1.3/2.1.4 beta 3**

**Issue description:**
When importing a large texture, the extension options are `.tex` (first) and `.ltex` (second), if the chosen extension is `.tex`, the editor shows 2 error windows saying that could not import the texture.

If have conflicts with `.tex` extensions, it should let import as `.ltex` only.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to import a large texture with `.tex` extension.

Some pictures:
Trying to import as `.tex`.

![ltexbug0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436258-16d1f08e-8381-11e7-8ff7-a9ba09fba8a9.png)

![ltexbug1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436171-c0f577d0-8380-11e7-8704-66289e3a36f0.png)

![ltexbug2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436181-c5c694b0-8380-11e7-93bf-bde44249b097.png)

![ltexbug3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436186-cbbb42c6-8380-11e7-8e63-eb36c141fff2.png)

Work as expected with `.ltex` extension.

![ltexbug4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436190-d1cabebc-8380-11e7-8c91-c05652e1e108.png)

![ltexbug5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/29436197-d683c656-8380-11e7-85ce-7d7a053e2f0d.png)

data.title: Using "previous" to go back from a doc to a script doesn't restore functions overview
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:
1) In the script editor, click/open a script
2) Click/open a documentation
3) Click the "previous" arrow to go back to the script: notice function overview isn't visible anymore
4) Click another script: notice it comes back

Interesting steps:
1) Click a script
2) Click a doc
3) Click again a script
4) Click "previous" to go back to the doc: notice function overview is still shown, but has no functions
5) Click "previous" again to go to a script: notice function overview is still shown and has function, as expected

data.title: Add closest_power_of_2 func and implement mix_rate/latency on OS X
data.body:
This PR does the following:

- Add two new functions on core/typedefs.h: previous_power_of_2 and closest_power_of_2.
- Rename nearest_power_of_2 to next_power_of_2.
- Implement mix_rate and latency settings on the OS X audio driver.
- Change samples_in from int32_t * to Vector<int32_t> for easier resizing of the array, on the OS X audio driver.
- Clean a bit the OS X audio driver code and add a missing kAudioUnitProperty_SetRenderCallback on the AudioDriverOSX::finish function to clear the callback.
- Use the new closest_power_of_2 function when calculating the buffer_size on the audio drivers.

Note/explanation: I've changed the name of nearest_power_of_2 to next_power_of_2 since it will always get the next power of 2. I found this out while implementing the latency setting on the OS X audio driver, the most common math for the buffer_size is: 25 * 44100 / 1000 (latency * mix_rate / 1000), which gives 1102, when calling nearest_power_of_2 it returned 2048 which is the next power of 2 (instead of 1024 which I was expecting), so that's why I added closest_power_of_2 which returns 1024 when called with 1102.

data.title: Opening a 3D scene tab containing 2D elements switches to 2D regardless of selection
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits

I have a 3D scene that contains spatial nodes, but also contains some 2D ones. I can see the 2D view when selecting 2D nodes, and 3D view when I select spatial nodes.
However, If I switch to another tab, then come back to the first one, the viewport switches back to 2D even though I have a spatial node still selected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29435090-f1141a5a-83a5-11e7-85a5-29252f2e06a4.png)

data.title: Shadow mapping ignores backfaces
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia 940 M
Feedback from this thread: https://godotengine.org/qa/17123/render-back-faces-to-shadow-map?show=17346#c17346

Directional lights don't produce any shadow when used on backfaces. This is a must have for any optimized interior scene, or even some exterior scenes. 

Lights currently project shadow only from front faces. To be honest, I think they should project shadows from backfaces instead, it makes more sense when you think about it (or there should at least be an option if projecting shadows from front faces is required).

Edit: in fact this should be an option per mesh or per material, like: "Shadow mode: none, front, back, two-sided"

Repro:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29433718-a00fa16a-83a0-11e7-876a-5f9fddb13694.png)

On a game level, in 3.0:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29433863-32b8d8e2-83a1-11e7-9a1b-73e67f93d694.png)

In the platformer demo:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29435926-6f4b0a7a-83a9-11e7-955b-75a519f83f36.png)

data.title: Fix UV calculation for spritesheet in particles
data.body:
I have fixed uniform names of spacial shader for horizontal and vertical frames count. They are used in case of BILLBOARD_PARTICLES billboard mode. Code of UV calculation was just commented. It didn't work because of wrong uniform names.

Also I have fixed UV offset calculation, so animation is working too now.

data.title: renamed 'draw_center' -> 'filled'
data.body:
Since the 'better flat stylebox' got merged it wanted to propose to rename all draw_center to filled.
the advantage is when using the new property style syntax in gd script it makes more sense:
```gdscript
myStylebox.filled = false
```

 -  it is shorter and confirms to how it is called now in style box flat.
 - the flat style box uses it and one or the other has to be changed anyways for consistency
 - I  would guess a beginner probably ask auto complete for `fill` than `draw` or `center`.

data.title: rename facefordward shader function to faceforward
data.body: there is a typo in shader language

data.title: Removed unused variable
Separate user data directory for Godot 3
data.body:
We already have config and layouts files named differently for 3.0, but I wonder if it would be better to have a separate folder for Godot 3.

Reason: to prevent possible conflicts (future or present but not already noticed, like maybe export templates) and to add the ability to uninstall or clean Godot 2 and 3 user data separately.

Now the folder is pretty confusing regarding what files/subdirectories belong to each branch.

data.title: Drop support for old mingw32 (unmaintained), only keep mingw-w64 (maintained)
data.body:
Reminder for myself to drop support for the old mingw32 unmaintained toolchain (last release in 2013), and keep support only for its 2005 fork mingw-w64 which is much better.

Note: The names are weird, but this issue does not mean dropping win32 support. mingw-w64 can compile for 32-bit Windows too.

So I should drop this https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/windows/detect.py#L41
And also update the slightly confusing documentation about cross-compiling: http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/development/compiling/compiling_for_windows.html#cross-compiling-for-windows-from-other-operating-systems

data.title: Crash on Startup on Android Devices [Godot 3.0 Alpha 1]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Godot 3.0 Alpha 1
- Device 1: LG K-220 (Android 6.0.1)
- Device 2: Samsung GT-N5110 (Android 4.1.2)
- Java: jdk1.8.0_77
- Templates and Godot.exe are used from this [Link](https://downloads.tuxfamily.org/godotengine/3.0/alpha1/)

**Issue description:**
- LG Device: Only shows White screen directy after startup
- Samsung Device: shows "Unfortunately,Godot Engine has stopped." message directly after startup


**Steps to reproduce:**
- Connecting Android Devices via USB Cable with PC
- Enable USB Debugging on both devices
- Exporting project by klicking on the Android icon in the top right corner of the Editor window.

**Additional description:**
- I Installed the templates via: Editor > Manage Export Templates >Install from File
- Configured Adb, jarsigner and Debug Keystore path manually

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[MinimalExample.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1231016/MinimalExample.zip)

data.title: Joy Axis in Input Mappin
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 3.0 Alpha Build 1

**Issue description:**
I tried mapping Joy Axis Device 0 Axis 0 - Left Stick Left to "ui_left"
However it wasn't reading the mapping when using Input.is_action_pressed("ui_left")
Also when I reopened the project the mapping I added was gone


**Steps to reproduce:**
in Project Settings > Input Mapping > "ui_left" add Joy Axis Device 0 Axis 0 - Left Stick Left
If you reopen the project it won't be mapped anymore.
If you create a script and do if Input.is_action_pressed("ui_left"): print('here')  , "here" won't show up because it doesn't read the Joy Axis has being mapped.  

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
